We use a vast and varied data asset to help non-profits exceed their donation goals, and commercial companies achieve higher ROI on their marketing spend. As a Data Analyst at Windfall, your role will be to contribute to a deeper understanding of these data assets, and how they can be used to provide value for our business and for our clients.


At Windfall, data is our product — and data lies at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you will have the opportunity to advance your analytical skills, working alongside an incredibly talented team of Analysts, Data Scientists and Engineers.


We’re on a mission to change how organizations perceive and use people data. And we hold true to our core values of: (1) Be an excellent communicator; (2) Operate with transparency; (3) Provide leverage, not optimization; (4) Make a difference every day; and (5) Act with integrity and trust.


Responsibilities:

  • Aggregate data from several sources and conduct data research to generate accurate analysis to support our product development.
  • Generate visualizations leveraging different technologies to be included in slide decks and dashboards.
  • Influence internal stakeholders by constructing slide decks from inception and effectively communicate results.
  • Deeply understand and document structures and processes that make up our data pipeline.
  • Investigate the quality and relationships of new and existing data sources. Perform analyses, extract insights, and make recommendations on next steps.


Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 2-4 years of professional work experience (excluding internships) in an Analyst role
  • Proficient in SQL
  • Intermediate Python experience
  • Collaborative team-focused attitude with a strong desire and learn new things and support the business
  • A fierce sense of ownership and responsibility in one’s work
  • Ability to translate a business problem into technical steps, and data-driven insights into recommendations
  • Demonstrates attention to detail


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated experience building dashboards

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote, New York City, or Oakland


Travel is encouraged approximately once a quarter, and occasionally required.


Role Type: Full-time

Compensation: $97,000

Visa sponsorship: Not available

Hires remotely in: United States

Experience: 3+ years of full-time, professional work experience

PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS ROLE VIA: https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/recidiviz/jobs/4406926006

Recidiviz is thrilled to be hiring a Data Analyst to join our team! We're a small, fast-moving group that works with complex criminal justice data from our state partners and develops analyses and tools that target the drivers of incarceration. That's where you come in. We're looking for someone who has attention to detail to improve our analysis, creativity and inquisitiveness to identify and solve open-ended problems, clarity to think through complex and variable data, flexibility to adjust in a rapidly evolving environment, and above all else, a collaborative, kind nature to add to our culture.

About Us

Recidiviz is creating safer, healthier communities by improving outcomes for people in the criminal justice system. We build technology to reduce the number of people in prison and to help criminal justice leaders embrace data-driven decision-making.

Using software tools and thoughtful product design, we've been able to safely and permanently reduce incarceration and improve outcomes. We work side-by-side with leaders of the criminal justice system, people in prison and on supervision, and ecosystem partners to build a better path forward. In addition to the revenue we earn from state partners, some of the most respected philanthropists and foundations support our work.

People who succeed at Recidiviz lead with kindness and humility, assume good intent, learn from failure, and fix problems when they see them. They are excited to work arm in arm with government leadership and staff to improve outcomes. They are great listeners. They build deep relationships with and empathy for the people we work with and the people who our mission serves, even when those two groups feel at odds.

About The Role

This role collaborates across several teams to guide work that targets the drivers of incarceration. Our Data Analysts work with diverse data – criminal justice data both raw and processed from across the country, reports and policy documents from government agencies, and much more – to develop our understanding of the criminal justice system and to motivate change. They perform analyses, contribute to tooling that improve our data and how we work with it, and help drive product launches by ensuring each product in each state has the analytical data required to drive the impact we seek. Our Data Analysts also play a key role in contextualizing and presenting their analyses to key stakeholders, both internal and external.

Travel is encouraged approximately once a quarter, and occasionally required.

Core responsibilities


Exploring our datasets to find new insights about American criminal justice systems
Contextualizing and communicating key findings to internal and external stakeholders
Collaborating with our State Engagement and Implementation Engineering teams to design and execute on targeted roadmaps that drive impact in the states where we work
Collaborating with our Product Management, Data Science, and Software Engineering teams to bring analyses and data modeling into production software
Analyzing trends and changes in areas related to our own work to understand how our products function


Wild success

A year from now:


You've driven impact. Your work has led to several launches of our products across the country and has helped quantify the impact those tools are having on the outcomes of the justice system.
You've leveled up our analytical team. Your contributions to our tooling and processes, as well as your support for your teammates, has helped set our team up to achieve more impact sooner.


Minimum Qualifications


3 or more years of professional experience exploring, analyzing, and processing complex datasets
Strong communication and collaboration skills, to help nurture a knowledgeable, data-oriented culture
Enthusiasm for working with internal and external partners from diverse backgrounds and worldviews, such as government staff, researchers, journalists, technical staff, and practitioners in criminal justice reform
Ability to inspect source data, reason about data models, examine results closely, and prepare data and analyses that are usable for various applications
Professional work experience using SQL to work with large datasets, including high proficiency writing efficient queries for more complex data extraction and transformation tasks
High familiarity with Python, specifically Pandas package, for tasks such as statistical analysis and data visualization


Preferred Qualifications


Experience working in a cross-functional organization that designs, builds, and launches products for users
Experience working with large datasets from the public sector, especially related to criminal justice
Familiarity with our data stack, which includes Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, Looker, Jupyter notebooks, and Python/Pandas


Compensation

Compensation is standardized based on roles and responsibilities. This ensures equitable compensation and responsible stewardship of our resources. As such, we do not negotiate compensation offers.

The compensation for this role is: $97,000.

What we offer


Effective, extremely thoughtful colleagues, working together on a mission that matters
90% medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage for you and your dependents
Flexible time off, including 20 days of PTO, 3 days of paid volunteering time, and 13 paid holidays
12 weeks of paid parental leave
401(k) retirement plan with 5% company match and no vesting period
Complimentary One Medical membership (depending on location)
Partnership with Carrot to provide employees with inclusive fertility and family-forming benefits, as well as a small but growing number of hormonal health and gender-affirming care benefits
Monthly ClassPass credit for personal wellness
Free mental health support via Talkspace
Well-located offices in Oakland and Manhattan, with the flexibility to work remotely or go into either office as you choose
An annual company offsite each spring and other ad-hoc gatherings
All the exhilarating challenges and stretch opportunities of a tech startup, combined with the mission-driven heart of a nonprofit


More about Recidiviz

Recidiviz was an all-volunteer effort until early 2019, when Clementine, Andrew, and Joshua founded the organization. Since then, we've built an A-team of software engineers, designers, product managers and domain experts, from companies like Google, Apple, Dropbox, Opower, and Sidewalk Labs. Recidiviz was part of Y-Combinator's 2019 class and has received support from some of the most respected philanthropists and foundations, including Ford Foundation, Mackenzie Scott, Schmidt Futures, Arnold Ventures, Chan Zuckerberg Initiative, and the Mozilla Foundation.

Today, Recidiviz works with (and earns revenue from) over 15 state partners – big and small, red and blue – and covers more than 40% of the US incarcerated population. We have helped to get tens of thousands of people out of the criminal justice system, safely and equitably, and saved states nearly $1 billion. In the next five years, Recidiviz plans to partner with 40 states and help 250,000 people who are stuck in the system to get out and stay out. In addition to partnering with state Departments of Corrections, Recidiviz collaborates with and learns from partners – from organizations like the Correctional Leaders Association (CLA) to community based organizations and justice-impacted individuals, whose perspectives guide our work.

To learn more about how we do what we do, check out our 2023 Year in Review, read some press coverage, or watch our TED Talk. And if you're really keen to see our work, you can dive into our Github :).

An important note

Lasting change is always built on diversity. Recidiviz recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, gender identity and all protected status as required by applicable law. We consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a special need that requires accommodation, please let us know in your application. Even if you don't think you meet all the criteria above, drop your resume, and we'll take a look – you might be great for another role or another time!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you interested in private equity research? Value Add is hiring a part-time data analyst to conduct research on PE-backed companies. The ideal candidate should be familiar with financial metrics and the sort of operational improvements PE firms make in portfolio companies.




This position is 5-10 hours per week to begin, and is a great opportunity for a motivated student to get paid to research the private equity industry.




Responsibilities

Research companies involved in private equity buyouts
Compile financial and operational data pertaining to companies
Fact-check existing data points that have already been collected




Qualifications

Attention to detail when collecting data
Interest in private equity research

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Content Strategy Analyst

Location: Cupertino, CA or Culver City, CA (hybrid or remote)

Duration: 6 months




Job Description:

Content Strategy Analyst




Description:

The ideal candidate is one who has been a top performer in his or her career with a consistent track record of accomplishment.

The candidate should feel comfortable dealing with complex and ambiguous situations.




As the Content Strategy Analyst, your responsibilities will include:

Analyze, collect, organize, and disseminate significant amount of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Create recurring and ad-hoc reports on content performance
Build and enhance dashboards in Tableau




Key Qualifications:

5+ years of relevant experience across business intelligence, data analytics, strategy, and management consulting, ideally prior work experience in the game industry
Passion for mobile games, and a hunger to help define the future of gaming
Extraordinary analytical skills with high proficiency in both Excel and Tableau (SQL experience is a plus)
Self-motivated, driven individual who is comfortable working a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Proven ability to synthesize insights from data and industry sources and package those insights into persuasive, impactful proposals




Typical Day

• Breakdown of the day: See list of projects below

• Interaction level with the team: Daily interaction with the content strategy team. Weekly check in with manager.

• Remote/Flexible hours: Preferred to be in Cupertino or Culver City

• Extension/Conversion: TBD depending on budget availability




Potential Projects:

Priority Games (Immediately)

• Send weekly email

• Compile the data for monthly priority

Business Review (Early next year)

• FTUE review

Content Planning (Late next year)

• Collecting updates and slatting it based on the framework created

Live service

• evaluation summaries, documentation around entire process, reviewing live ops plans, studying best practices.

Other initiatives (Immediately)

• Analyze impact of featuring

On-store attribution analysis

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: Local, In-Office, Hybrid schedule

Do you love technology and helping organizations utilize that technology to become greater than they thought possible? Are you interested in serving your community and doing your part to keep your community, nation, and planet safe? At Kaseware you will have the chance to do all of that and so much more as a Business Data Analyst. Kaseware is a company that is changing the world of law enforcement and corporate security forever and, if you are up for a challenge, we would like you to consider helping us make the world a safer place.

The Data Analyst will work directly with our clients to identify, build and maintain reports and visualization of their data, as well as transforming data from legacy systems and importing it into Kaseware. Applicants should have scripting skills in programming languages like SQL and Python, as you will be responsible for writing queries and other data transformation scripts as well as experience working directly with end users. This role is essential to our clients, as the data and analysis you provide will inform our client's business strategy as we move into the future. In addition, this specific role will also require some additional customer focused work, to include system training, and system administrator services within and in support of the Kaseware system.

Job Type: Full-time, Exempt

Responsibilities and Duties:


Uses modeling techniques and tools in analyzing and specifying data structure in large and/or complex data sets
Implementing best practices in data management to ensure the integrity of the data, the quality of data processes and delivers analyzable or analyzed data to a variety of internal and external clients
Understanding and transforming client data from disparate legacy systems into the Kaseware application
Working directly with customers to understand their data and visualization needs
Writing SQL scripts and queries to extract, migrate and visualize client data
Developing complex advancement reports using SQL, PowerBi, Microsoft Office and other utilities or languages as necessary
Utilizing Metabase to create client-facing reports, visualizations and dashboards
Performing ad hoc and structured data analysis
Identifying data issues proactively and flagging them to respective stakeholders
As needed, providing system training and system administrator services within and in support of the Kaseware system
Ability to travel to client sites (< 25% travel)

Required Education:


Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, Education, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Finance, Economics or a related field



Required Skills and Experience:


A minimum of 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Experience in data analysis, warehousing, and reporting (3-5 years preferred)
SQL skills and experience with other programming languages associated with data analytics
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Advanced technical skills
Excellent documentation skills
Experience providing client-facing support and/or training



Preferred Skills and Experience:


Experience using Metabase or a similar business intelligence tool



Other Requirements:


Language: English



Benefits:


Competitive salary and bonus program in an entrepreneurial environment
Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance (70% company paid)
Unlimited paid time off plan plus paid holidays
401k with company matching
EcoPass provided for Colorado-based employees
Salary Rage: $85,000-$110,000



About Kaseware:

Kaseware is a dynamic start-up company located in the Denver metro area. We build state-of-the-art software for law enforcement and corporate security customers. We serve those that serve our communities and make our world safer.

Due to the nature of our business, you must be able to pass a full CJIS compliant fingerprint based background check, which is required for individuals needing access to criminal justice information (CJI).

U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.

We expect this role to be open until September 30th or until filled.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JD:

Combination of data and analytics – we need someone with good SQL, PBI and GCP
Strong Analytics & logical skills & insurance experience is good to have
Role Overview:
We are looking for a go getter person who can define:
Analytic strategies to meet the demands of business requirements
Technical requirements of the analytic solutions
Data requirements of the analytic solution processes
The person will be part of the Data Analytics & Engineering team for a major Insurance client. He/ She will work with different stakeholders as SME for data analytics & engineering
Acquire data from primary or secondary sources, implement data collection systems and maintain databases.
Identify, develop and implement reporting and analytic tools
Develop dashboards for visual representation of performance using visual reporting tools
Engages in technical problem solving across multiple technologies; often needs to develop new solutions
A typical work day will involve working with stakeholders in individual contributor.
A suitable candidate should have 8-12 years of experience in a similar role and should possess a go -getter attitude. He/ She should be able to deal with ambiguity.
Experience in property and casualty insurance/actuarial projects preferred.
Having good hands on experience on SQL, Power BI, Google Cloud Platform
Having experience in developing ETL pipelines




Key Responsibilities & Skillsets:




Common Skillsets:

8-12 years of experience in analytics ETL and associated data engineering jobs.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform services
Excellent communication & presentation skills
Experience in managing SQL codes and performing data extraction/data wrangling
Data analysis and reporting using Power BI (DAX, data connection, etc.)
Good knowledge of SQL, Power BI and GCP
Should be able to work on a problem independently and prepare client ready deliverable with minimal or no supervision
Good communication skill for client interaction
Data Management Skillsets:
Ability to understand data models and identify ETL optimization opportunities. Exposure to ETL tools is preferred
Should have strong grasp of advanced advanced SQL functionalities (joins, nested query, and procedures).
Strong ability to translate functional specifications / requirements to technical requirements




Candidate Profile:




Bachelor’s/Master's degree in economics, mathematics, actuarial sciences, computer science/engineering, operations research or related analytics areas; candidates with BA/BS degrees in the same fields from the top tier academic institutions are also welcome to apply

Strong and in-depth understanding of DE Fundamentals & Data analysis experience

Superior analytical and problem solving skills

Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

Able to work in fast pace continuously evolving environment and ready to take up uphill challenges

HTML:
JD:

  • Combination of data and analytics – we need someone with good SQL, PBI and GCP
  • Strong Analytics & logical skills & insurance experience is good to have
  • Role Overview:
  • We are looking for a go getter person who can define:
  • Analytic strategies to meet the demands of business requirements
  • Technical requirements of the analytic solutions
  • Data requirements of the analytic solution processes
  • The person will be part of the Data Analytics & Engineering team for a major Insurance client. He/ She will work with different stakeholders as SME for data analytics & engineering
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary sources, implement data collection systems and maintain databases.
  • Identify, develop and implement reporting and analytic tools
  • Develop dashboards for visual representation of performance using visual reporting tools
  • Engages in technical problem solving across multiple technologies; often needs to develop new solutions
  • A typical work day will involve working with stakeholders in individual contributor.
  • A suitable candidate should have 8-12 years of experience in a similar role and should possess a go -getter attitude. He/ She should be able to deal with ambiguity.
  • Experience in property and casualty insurance/actuarial projects preferred.
  • Having good hands on experience on SQL, Power BI, Google Cloud Platform
  • Having experience in developing ETL pipelines


Key Responsibilities & Skillsets:


Common Skillsets:

  • 8-12 years of experience in analytics ETL and associated data engineering jobs.
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform services
  • Excellent communication & presentation skills
  • Experience in managing SQL codes and performing data extraction/data wrangling
  • Data analysis and reporting using Power BI (DAX, data connection, etc.)
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Power BI and GCP
  • Should be able to work on a problem independently and prepare client ready deliverable with minimal or no supervision
  • Good communication skill for client interaction
  • Data Management Skillsets:
  • Ability to understand data models and identify ETL optimization opportunities. Exposure to ETL tools is preferred
  • Should have strong grasp of advanced advanced SQL functionalities (joins, nested query, and procedures).
  • Strong ability to translate functional specifications / requirements to technical requirements


Candidate Profile:


Bachelor’s/Master's degree in economics, mathematics, actuarial sciences, computer science/engineering, operations research or related analytics areas; candidates with BA/BS degrees in the same fields from the top tier academic institutions are also welcome to apply

Strong and in-depth understanding of DE Fundamentals & Data analysis experience

Superior analytical and problem solving skills

Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

Able to work in fast pace continuously evolving environment and ready to take up uphill challenges

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Junior DATA ANALYST to join our team. In this role you will work across our client engagements, providing expertise in data collection, data analysis, data mapping, data profiling, data modeling data and will address issues related to data completeness and quality, as well as contribute to and produce technical and data process documentation.

What You Will Do

Prepare and conduct analyses and studies, needs assessment, and requirements analysis to align systems and solutions

Research and analyze healthcare data from various sources, then perform data mapping to integrate this information into our systems

Apply analytical methodologies and principles to meet client needs

Prepare forecast and analyze trends, develops and analyze metrics, and prepares reports and recommendations

Provide support for business performance, project analysis, internal control, risk assessment, and project objectives

Required Skills

B.S. in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Health Data Analytics

Minimum 2 years of recent professional experience in data science, data mining, data analysis, business process analysis, and/or healthcare analytics

Minimum 2 years of experience in data mapping and data profiling

Minimum 2 years of experience using SQL to evaluate data

Minimum 2 years of programming experience in a subset of Python (at least Jupyter Notebooks, SQL alchemy, and pandas)

Prior experience working with healthcare data, or in the Healthcare field

Previous experience in healthcare data analysis, data mapping, and medical coding systems (ICD-10, SNOMED, etc.)

Ability to conduct data profiling and predictive analysis using a variety of standard tools

Experience with data visualization tools and methodologies

Ability to communicate concisely and effectively with software engineers and clients


Ability to obtain a Public Trust determination


Preferred Skills


Previous experience working with federal government clients such as Dept. of Defense (DoD) or Dept. of Veterans Affairs (VA)
Prior experience with metadata management to include meta-tagging
Previous experience working in an Agile Team setting and using Agile management tools such as Jira
Experience conducting business process analysis to identify gaps and inefficiencies
Ability to uncover data-driven insights using statistical analysis or predictive analytics
To Obtain Public trust clearance Candidate should be Greencard or US citizen only. n

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst – (Subcontract at a Core BTS Client)




Through Core BTS Resource Management Services (RMS), we offer custom talent solutions to help our clients meet their evolving technology and business needs. We help effectively match the right technology professional to their organization, recruiting for contract, contract-to-hire, and direct roles. Our client in (area/region) has an immediate need for a (job title). Please note that this is a (contract/contract to hire/direct hire) opportunity with our client and NOT with Core BTS.




Job Summary:

Our client is seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join their team to support their financial and operational decision-making processes through insightful data analysis and reporting. The Data Analyst will be responsible for extracting, cleaning, analyzing, and reporting on financial and operational data. This role requires proficiency in Power BI, SQL Server, Alteryx, and ERP systems to create interactive dashboards and provide actionable insights to various departments.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Extraction and Integration:

Extract data from various databases using SQL queries, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Pull data from ERP systems to analyze financial and operational performance.

Data Cleaning and Transformation:

Use Alteryx to clean, transform, and prepare data for analysis, handling missing values, outliers, and ensuring data consistency.
Utilize Power Query in Power BI to further clean and shape data.

Financial Analysis and Reporting:

Create interactive financial dashboards and reports in Power BI to visualize key metrics such as revenue, expenses, profit margins, and other financial KPIs.
Perform financial data analysis using SQL queries to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

Data Validation and Quality Assurance:

Ensure the accuracy and reliability of financial data by validating it against predefined business rules.
Regularly audit data processes to maintain high data quality standards.

Collaboration and Communication:

Work closely with finance, operations, and other departments to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
Present findings to stakeholders through reports and dashboards, making data-driven recommendations.

Automation and Optimization:

Use tools like Alteryx to automate repetitive data tasks, improving efficiency.
Continuously seek ways to optimize data workflows and reporting processes.

Support for Business Decisions:

Provide data-driven insights to support strategic business decisions, such as cost reduction, investment opportunities, and performance improvement initiatives.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Finance, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in Power BI, SQL Server, Alteryx, and ERP systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Product Owner | Finance Data Reporting | Data Transformation Strategy | Investment Bank | The Hague | Hybrid WFH




For a mid-size entrepreneurial Investment Bank in the Hague, we're looking for a Senior Product Owner / Data Transformation Program Manager who will play a pivotal role in the Finance Data Transformation Strategy of the bank.




Environment & Team

The role sits within the Data & Analytics department, in the Finance Reporting team, directly reporting to the C-level Data Analytics Director. The team consists of 3 Financial Analyst, a Scrum master and you - the team will be extended with 3 other Financial Analysts/Data Engineers.




The D&A department consists of 7 teams in total. This role will be a cross-functional role, impacting the whole D&A department.




Your challenge

The main role of the department is to deliver high-quality data products built on a modern Cloud Data Platform, enhancing data-drivenness across the whole organization.




You will be responsible for steering the transition from legacy systems to a modern cloud-based data environment.




While ensuring the Finance department's data needs are still met, use case by use.




Your responsibilities

You oversee and manage the migration from on-premise data warehouses and legacy BI tools to a Cloud-Based data platform
You design a detailed roadmap for the migration of the financial reporting and integration data into a modern cloud environment
You prioritize use cases from the business teams based on their business- and strategic value to the business
You act as a primary point of contact between the Finance department and tech- and business teams, ensuring business needs are met to the highest standards and regulatory requirements are met
You'll work in an Agile way of working, together with the scrum master of the team: managing product backlogs, defining user stories and ensuring deadlines are met within the set time frame
Team leadership: guide and support more junior members of the team, including data engineers, analysts and potential external vendors to ensure high-quality deliverables




Tech Stack

Azure Cloud Platform, Data Lakes, Modern Data Architecture, PowerBI, Agile/Scrum way of working, Azure Data Factory, DBT, Databricks, Financial data.




Your profile and experience

7+ years of work experience as Product Owner, Transition Data Manager, or Program manager in a data-driven environment, focusing on cloud-based transformations and large-scale data migrations.
You have a finance industry background and are familiar with finance processes, data reporting flows and regulatory requirements
Cloud & Data Platforms: you have familiarity with cloud data platforms (Azure), Power BI, data lakes, and modern data architectures




The bank offers great benefits:

32 (!!) holidays
Hyrid working from The Hague office
Best pension in the Netherlands (+30% of annual salary)
Excellent Learning & Development programs
NS Business card 1st Class
Powerful challenger bank and Sustainability at its core




Does this role sound like a great opportunity to you (it is!!) - do not hesitate to apply - the role is URGENT!

Start date: 1st of December (ideally)
Urgent role
Two-stage interview process (finish interview process in October, leave notice in November, start 1s of December)
Permanent position (no freelancers)




Senior Product Owner | Finance Data Reporting | Data Transformation Strategy | Investment Bank | The Hague | Hybrid WFH

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Contexte




Pour le compte d'une grande banque française basée à paris, vous interviendrez en tant que Data Analyst Senior au sein de l’équipe DATA, qui est en charge de fournir les moyens de piloter, contrôler, animer et analyser l’activité du périmètre de l'entreprise.




Missions




La mission consiste à développer, automatiser de nouveaux reports via SAS, TABLEAU DESKTOP & DATAIKU et à gérer les évolutions de KPI(s) dans les formats déjà existant au sein d'une BU RETAIL.

Il faudra également valider les données de d’activité de la BU RETAIL lors des différents closing de fin de mois.

La mission consiste également à fournir des recommandations (de process) pour améliorer la qualité des datas dans les outils et de réaliser des analyses de données pour le métier.

Qualifications




3+ ans sur un poste similaire
SAS (langage SAS & SQL) Expertise (obligatoire)
DATAIKU Maitrise (obligatoire)
Excel Maitrise

Show more

Title: Data Analyst – (H/F)
Description:
Infotel Conseil accompagne les directions Informatiques et Métiers des grandes entreprises depuis plus de 40 ans (Airbus, BNP Paribas, Banque de France, BPCE, Air France, Arkéa, Stellantis, etc.). C’est aujourd’hui plus de 3 000 Infotéliens qui ont rejoint le groupe en France (Paris, Toulouse, Lyon, Bordeaux, Lille, Rennes, Nantes, etc.) et à l’étranger (UK, Monaco, Allemagne, US, Canada, Inde, Maroc). Nous avons ainsi réalisé en 2023 un chiffre d’affaires de 307,5 M€.

Infotel Conseil, spécialiste des projets IT, intervient pour ses clients sur la gestion et l’évolution de leur patrimoine informatique.

VOS MISSIONS

Responsabilités


Support de proximité auprès des utilisateurs finaux.
Création de Manufacturing Master (MM) et de Measure Inspection Report (MIR) pour la structure de l’avion et pour les mesures planchers (Gap Gun).
Ecriture des Variations Analysis Memorandum (VAM).
Construction de Dashboard de reporting Client et Top Management de l’Usine.
Lire et Analyser des fichiers XML.
Gestion de base de données (Skywise et module Pyspark).


Qualifications


Formation d’Ingénieur scientifique ou d’Informatique (Bac+5)
Un bon niveau d’anglais est requis
La connaissance Azure serait un plus
La connaissance de Python serait un plus afin de simplifier la génération des XML
La connaissance du logiciel CATIA V5 serait appréciable


Une montée en compétence peut être réalisée si vous ne possédez pas toutes les qualifications ci-dessus.

VOTRE PROFIL

Cette opportunité est ouverte à tout type de filières. Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’un bac+5 et vous souhaitez vous tourner vers des postes en lien avec l’aéronautique et l’informatique.

Vous recherchez une entreprise nourrie de fortes valeurs humaines, dans laquelle il fait bon vivre.

Autonome, motivé(e), et rigoureux(se) vous savez prioriser les tâches et coordonner les activités sous votre responsabilité. Vous avez le sens du service, d’excellentes aptitudes en organisation et un bon relationnel.

Votre potentiel, votre dynamisme, votre sérieux et votre implication vous permettront d’évoluer régulièrement au sein d’Infotel. N’hésitez pas, venez nous rencontrer pour échanger sur le sujet !

NOTRE ENVIRONNEMENT INFOTELIEN

Vous évoluerez sous la direction du Directeur de Business Line. Selon votre potentiel et vos souhaits de carrière, plusieurs possibilités s’offriront à vous : pilotage de projet, management d’équipe, ou encore expertise métier.

Lors du processus d’embauche, vous serez amené à remplir un questionnaire visant à faciliter l’échange lors de vos rencontres avec les différents interlocuteurs (recruteurs, directeurs).

En devenant Infotélien vous rejoindrez une entreprise qui place la RSE au cœur de ses engagements à travers sa politique RH :  


Égalité entre les femmes et les hommes (création d’une communauté interne « Infot’Elles »),  
Actions concrètes pour le bien-être et la qualité de vie au travail, 
Charte Handicap « Nous sommes tous différents »,  
Engagement pour le Numérique Responsable et l’environnement, 
Etc. 


Nos offres d’emploi sont ouvertes à tous sans distinction de genre ou d’un quelconque autre critère discriminant. Nos chargés de recrutement restent à disposition si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur nos valeurs et nos engagements. 

Si votre profil est retenu, un chargé de recrutement prendra contact avec vous afin de discuter de votre parcours et de vos souhaits pour rejoindre Infotel. Vous aurez ensuite l’occasion de rencontrer l’un de nos ingénieurs d’affaires et/ou Directeurs d’agence avec qui vous pourrez échanger de manière plus précise sur nos opportunités.  

Nous avons hâte de lire votre candidature  !  

postulez

Title: Analityk Danych
Description:
Dla międzynarodowego producenta komponentów przemysłowych, prowadzimy obecnie rekrutacje na stanowisko Analityka Danych.

Wynagrodzenie: 16 000 - 19 000 PLN brutto

Wymagania


Wyższe wykształcanie (preferowane kierunki: Ekonomia, Technologia Informatyczna, Analiza Danych lub pokrewne).
Co najmniej 3 lat doświadczenia na podobnym stanowisku, praca w środowisku produkcyjnym będzie dodatkowym atutem.
Co najmniej 5 lata doświadczenia w zarządzaniu, przetwarzania i analizie danych.
Znajomość narzędzi do wizualizacji danych np. Power BI.
Zaawansowana znajomość narzędzi MS Office - PowerPivot, Excel.
Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego.
Umiejętność analitycznego myślenia.
Wysoko rozwinięte umiejętności komunikacyjne.


Do Twoich Zadań Będzie Należało


Planowanie, prognozowanie i analiza danych w obszarze produkcyjnym oraz magazynowym.
Tworzenie wydajnych procesów formatowania, przetwarzania oraz strukturyzowania danych.
Bliska współpraca z kluczowymi klientami - raportowanie wskaźników, danych oraz wsparcie merytoryczne.
Tworzenie, wizualizacja oraz prezentowanie intuicyjnych dashboardów oraz raportów przy użyciu niezbędnych narzędzi i technologii.
Przekazywanie spostrzeżeń pomiędzy klientem oraz poszczególnymi działami firmy.
Show more
HTML:
Dla międzynarodowego producenta komponentów przemysłowych, prowadzimy obecnie rekrutacje na stanowisko Analityka Danych.

Wynagrodzenie: 16 000 - 19 000 PLN brutto

Wymagania

  • Wyższe wykształcanie (preferowane kierunki: Ekonomia, Technologia Informatyczna, Analiza Danych lub pokrewne).
  • Co najmniej 3 lat doświadczenia na podobnym stanowisku, praca w środowisku produkcyjnym będzie dodatkowym atutem.
  • Co najmniej 5 lata doświadczenia w zarządzaniu, przetwarzania i analizie danych.
  • Znajomość narzędzi do wizualizacji danych np. Power BI.
  • Zaawansowana znajomość narzędzi MS Office - PowerPivot, Excel.
  • Dobra znajomość języka angielskiego.
  • Umiejętność analitycznego myślenia.
  • Wysoko rozwinięte umiejętności komunikacyjne.

Do Twoich Zadań Będzie Należało

  • Planowanie, prognozowanie i analiza danych w obszarze produkcyjnym oraz magazynowym.
  • Tworzenie wydajnych procesów formatowania, przetwarzania oraz strukturyzowania danych.
  • Bliska współpraca z kluczowymi klientami - raportowanie wskaźników, danych oraz wsparcie merytoryczne.
  • Tworzenie, wizualizacja oraz prezentowanie intuicyjnych dashboardów oraz raportów przy użyciu niezbędnych narzędzi i technologii.
  • Przekazywanie spostrzeżeń pomiędzy klientem oraz poszczególnymi działami firmy.

Title: Data Analyst - temporary
Description:
This is a great opportunity to join us as a Data Analyst in our Bucharest office.




In this role you will be responsible for analyzing vehicle data to improve gaps in our catalogue. You'll actively work on linking vehicles, OE (original equipment) number and competitor numbers and will report to the Catalogue Data & Systems Manager. In this role you will improve our catalogue data quality, coverage and be contributing to increasing sales.







Key responsibilities

Monitor and improve catalogue data and content.
Works together with internal customers on how to improve catalogue data.
Provide guidance to product data manager on harmonization and standardization.
Monitor and control the KPI’s and identify the opportunities and corrective actions.
Coverage, IAM interchanges and data quality improvements TRC, SRS and DQM.
Working with the product management teams to assure that all the new parts are properly setup and that the EOL is also reflected in Xchecker.
Create & maintain ISO metric drawings based on the platforms.







Your skills & expertise

Proactive approach and attention to detail.
Demonstrate the ability to generate ideas and effectively manage multiple projects/ assignments while achieving results.
Communicate effectively with all functional areas of the European business to achieve goals.
Fluent in English other Languages an advantage.
Support and adhere to core values.
Excellent in Office 365.
Ability to work with Power BI is considered a plus.







What we offer

We want to make you feel welcomed, challenged, and inspired and so we’ve made sure to carefully put together a blend of benefits meant to boost your health and well-being, to ensure your personal and professional growth and also your integration in a pleasant day-to-day working environment.




About us

Headquartered in Lake Forest, Illinois, Tenneco is one of the world's leading designers, manufacturers and marketers of Aftermarket, Ride Performance, Clean Air and Powertrain products and technology solutions for diversified markets.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Insurance




Fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join an innovative and reputable financial services organisation who is going through growth in Ireland.




The role will be responsible for collecting, analysing and interpreting data to support informed decision-making within the organisation. You will play a crucial role in extracting meaningful insights from large datasets, identifying trends and providing actionable recommendations to enhance business strategies. The position requires a strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.




The Role




Gather and extract financial data from various sources
Ensure data accuracy and reliability through data validation processes.
Transform data into a format suitable for analysis, ensuring data integrity and quality.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, trends and anomalies.
Utilise statistical methods and techniques to derive actionable insights from financial datasets.
Develop and maintain financial models to simulate different scenarios and assess potential impacts on business outcomes.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to present analytical findings to stakeholders.
Use visualisation tools to communicate complex data insights effectively.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and address analytical needs.
Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to ensure the availability and accessibility of required data.
Identify opportunities to enhance data analytics processes and tools.




The Person




Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Finance, Economics, Statistics, Data Science).
Previous experience as a Data Analyst in the insurance sector.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI).
Expertise in statistical analysis tools (R, Python).
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong understanding of Business Intelligence strategies.
Effective communication skills to convey findings to non-technical stakeholders.




Contact David on david@kennedyandpartners.ie | 086 440 3623 for more information on this role or make an easy application through the link provided.

Title: Data Engineer- Analyst (H/M)
Description:
¿Quiénes somos?




Axians, es la marca de VINCI Energies especializada en las tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones (TIC), que proporciona un amplio espectro de soluciones y servicios para atender las necesidades de las empresas en infraestructuras IT y comunicaciones.




Axians, apuesta por la igualdad de oportunidades para todas las personas, independientemente de su condición, con planes corporativos destinados a asumir un fuerte compromiso con la no discriminación y fomentar un entorno respetuoso, asegurando un comportamiento ético entre todas las personas que formamos VINCI Energies.




¿Qué necesitamos?




Actualmente nos encontramos en búsqueda de perfil de Data Engineer- Analyst (H/M) para trabajar en nuestras oficinas de Madrid.







Funciones:




Diseñar, construir y mantener infraestructuras de datos, garantizando la calidad, integridad y disponibilidad de los datos.




Desarrollo de pipelines de datos eficientes, crear y mantener modelos de datos para análisis, colaborar con equipos técnicos y de negocio, y asegurar el cumplimiento de políticas de gestión de datos para respaldar la toma de decisiones informadas y estratégicas.




Gestionar y optimizar infraestructuras de datos, así como de transformar datos en información accionable para respaldar la toma de decisiones estratégicas y operativas







Requisitos:




Licenciatura o grado en áreas relacionadas como Informática, Ingeniería Informática, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería de Datos, o campos similares.
Mínimo de 2-3 años trabajando en roles relacionados con análisis de datos, inteligencia empresarial o análisis de negocios.
Experiencia práctica utilizando Power BI para la visualización de datos, creación de informes interactivos y paneles de control.
Experiencia en Manipulación de Datos: Sólidos conocimientos en la manipulación y limpieza de datos utilizando herramientas como SQL, Excel, Python, R u otras.
Experiencia en Análisis de Datos: Capacidad demostrada para analizar conjuntos de datos complejos y extraer insights significativos para respaldar la toma de decisiones.
Inglés B2







Conocimientos:

Certificaciones relevantes como la Certificación de Power BI de Microsoft pueden ser consideradas como un plus.
Portafolio o muestras de trabajo previo utilizando Power BI y otros datos sería beneficioso para evaluar las habilidades del candidato.
Dominio avanzado de Excel para análisis de datos, incluyendo funciones, tablas dinámicas y gráficos.
Fuertes habilidades en SQL para la extracción, manipulación y transformación de datos de bases de datos relacionales.
Habilidades para limpiar, transformar y combinar datos de diversas fuentes para su análisis.
Capacidad para aplicar técnicas estadísticas y de análisis de datos para identificar patrones, tendencias y relaciones significativas.
Conocimientos básicos de programación en Python, R u otro lenguaje similar sería una ventaja.
Familiaridad con bases de datos relacionales y entornos de almacenamiento de datos como SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.
Comprensión de principios de diseño de visualización de datos y mejores prácticas para la presentación efectiva de información.







Competencias:

Capacidad para liderar y proponer soluciones innovadoras
Capacidad para analizar problemas complejos y encontrar soluciones efectivas.
Capacidad para trabajar de manera independiente y gestionar múltiples tareas simultáneamente.
Habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita para interactuar con diferentes equipos y presentar resultados de análisis.







¿Qué ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido
Salario competitivo en función de la valía profesional y experiencia del candidato
Amplio paquete de beneficios sociales (seguro de salud privado, ticket restaurant, pago compartido de internet….)
Formación y desarrollo profesional.
Retribución flexible.
Medidas de conciliación: flexibilidad horaria, teletrabajo y jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano




VINCI Energies está presente en 53 países y ofrece soluciones y servicios cada vez más innovadores en cuatro líneas de negocio: infraestructuras, industria, sector servicios y TIC. A través de estas actividades, VINCI Energies tiene una capacidad única en el mercado de conectar las infraestructuras, edificios e instalaciones industriales a sistemas de información y energía cada día más fiables, seguros y eficientes, gracias a un servicio integral que cubre desde el diseño hasta la implementación, operación y mantenimiento, infraestructuras de energía, transporte y comunicación.




VINCI Energies responde a los retos actuales de movilidad, energía, medio ambiente y convivencia mediante una dinámica constante de innovación de sus ofertas y soluciones, con la participación de nuestros clientes y demás partes interesadas para contribuir a la construcción de un mundo más sostenible.




En España VINCI Energies despliega su oferta a través de 3 marcas: Axians, Actemium y Omexom

Title: Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV and cover letter via our application portal. To show us that you've read the entire job ad, please include the phrase 'YES, I AM SUNDAY'S NEW TEAM MEMBER' in the first sentence of your cover letter.

Contact

Sabrina Thome

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy – as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of 190 people and 37 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Analyst to join us!




Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.




We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.




Our values

We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!




What you will do




The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.




You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.




Responsibilities




Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework




Qualifications




Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
Experience with DBT.
Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing




Perks & Benefits at Tiqets




Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
Pension scheme and travel compensation
Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
Hybrid working model
Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
Reimbursement home workspace necessities




Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

HTML:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Analyst to join us!


Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.


We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.


Our values

  • We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
  • We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
  • We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!


What you will do


The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.


You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.


Responsibilities


  • Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
  • Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
  • Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
  • Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
  • Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
  • Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
  • Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
  • Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework


Qualifications


  • Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
  • 3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
  • Experience with DBT.
  • Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
  • Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
  • Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
  • Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing


Perks & Benefits at Tiqets


  • Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
  • Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
  • Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
  • 20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
  • Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
  • Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
  • Pension scheme and travel compensation
  • Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
  • Hybrid working model
  • Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
  • Reimbursement home workspace necessities


Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

Title: Data Analyst - biosignal analysis
Description:
Are you interested in developing new healthcare technology targeted to international markets, further developing new products with a talented and ambitious team? Do you find it motivating to work on a meaningful job helping people suffering severe chronic conditions and enable the healthcare system to better serve those in need. Adamant Health is now looking for a person to work as an data analyst and scientist and to help the company to realise its vision.




Adamant Health Oy is looking for:




Data analyst & scientist




Job type: Full-time (permanent) or part-time (worktime 50% or more)

Location: Finland

Languages: English, Finnish, German (bonus)

Start-date: Immediately or as agreed

Place of work: Hybrid, preferably in Kuopio or Helsinki region

Company: Adamant Health Oy

Application deadline: 31.10.2024 (recruitment will be done once a suitable candidate is found)




Adamant Health is a Finnish healthcare technology start-up and spin-off from the University of Eastern Finland. Our mission is to help people with Parkinson’s disease and other movement disorders by bringing new data driven treatment practices into the way people are treated and medicated. Adamant Health stands out from the competition with its unique technology based on extensive academic research and medical device status (CE marked). The company was founded in August 2020 and has 15 professionals working in Helsinki, Kuopio, Oulu, Tampere and Turku regions.




Adamant Health is growing and entering a new phase in its journey, and we are now looking for a person to work as a data analyst and scientist for the company. In this role you will analyse the data measured from the patient with our leading measurement and analysis service and create symptom reports used by our customers. Another key task is to further develop our service, the advanced algorithms used and work closely together with our Chief Scientist and co-founder Saara Rissanen, PhD and Docent. We are looking for a person who is enthusiastic about learning and growing into the role for those aspects which still may be new for you. As part of the team, you will have a unique opportunity to build the number one company in providing data driven Parkinson’s treatment.




You will succeed in this position with prior experience in signal processing and analysis preferably related to human neurophysiology. You have expertise in algorithm development and experience in programming with Matlab. You are good in documenting and communicating your work results in English. Prior experience related to movement disorders, machine learning, utilising AI in data analysis, familiarity with medical device development and co-writing scientific articles are considered as a plus.




Key responsibilities of the role include:

Performing data analysis on neurophysiological, motion and patient reported outcome data and produce analysis results and reports for customers.
Participate in further development of the algorithms and data analysis automation.
Support customer cases and projects
Participate in clinical and case study project planning and execution




If you think you are at your best when working in a dynamic start-up environment and you want to have a strong purpose and meaningful job in a team developing healthcare technology for a better tomorrow, this is a great opportunity for you.




To be successful in this role you have:

Master’s degree or close to graduate in relevant topics such as medical physics, medical engineering, or medical technology.
Relevant work experience with biosignal analysis is considered a plus
Prior experience with algorithm development and data analysis using Matlab is mandatory and with Python is considered a plus
Prior experience with Atlassian (Jira & Confluence) tools is considered a plus.
Genuine interest to work in a healthcare start-up.
Motivated to ramp-up new and succeed in a job with wide range of responsibilities and ambition to learn continuously.
Professional in English, as the main working language. Finnish and German considered a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team, combined with good communication and social skills.




Why you should join Adamant Health:

A meaningful job and opportunity to work for improving people lives and for better healthcare
Work with a diverse team of experts with various backgrounds
Freedom to arrange and organise your work
A chance to be a part of a dynamic start-up team aiming high




If you feel that you are the right person for the job with a matching background and experience, please send your application and CV ASAP via LinkedIn. Please include your salary expectations and your first possible start date.




www.adamanthealth.com
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.


Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.




Job Description



As part of a larger Data Team, your primary responsibility will be managing our Unit4 FP&A tool alongside two colleagues. Unit4 FP&A is a comprehensive software solution designed to streamline financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and analytical processes, helping organizations achieve optimal financial performance at a reduced cost.


You will be responsible for collecting, transforming, and modeling data, building reports and dashboards, and ensuring all outputs align with our business goals and financial objectives.


The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of business processes, system integration, and technical troubleshooting, while demonstrating strong collaboration and communication skills with multiple stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities:


Analyze, identify, and resolve data quality and integrity issues with strong attention to detail.
Translate business requirements into data-driven solutions to improve financial operations.
Create, maintain, and enhance reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using Unit4 FP&A.
Develop and maintain well-organized data models for efficient analysis.
Integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow across systems and departments.
Provide technical support and training to end users while troubleshooting and resolving data or system issues.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Technology, Data Analytics).
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, including experience in complex database development, reporting, and automation.
Familiarity with CRM (preferably Dynamics CRM) and ERP systems. Expertise in Power BI or similar BI tools is a plus.
Strong communication skills in English, with excellent stakeholder management abilities.
Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes.
Proficiency in cleaning, preprocessing, and organizing raw data.
Expertise in visualization tools like Power BI or similar.
Ability to create clear, insightful, and visually engaging reports, charts, and graphs.
Skilled in communicating complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficient in database systems with the ability to write complex queries.
Experience working with relational and cloud data platforms (e.g., MS SQL, Snowflake).
Ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating across departments.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to clearly convey findings.
Capability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines efficiently.
Strong prioritization skills to focus on the most critical analyses.
Ability to keep up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and financial reporting tools.
Proactive in seeking opportunities for skill development and technical advancements.
Adhering to data privacy regulations and upholding ethical standards in all aspects of data handling.

Office: Lisbon, expected onsite presence 2-3 days a week.




Additional Information



Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us.


At Unit4, we offer:


a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.
Show more

  • talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
  • a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
  • a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst – Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Show more
