Title: Data Analyst F/H
Description:
Data Analyst F/H




Big Data, Data Science, Data analyse, Data architecture ... Ça n’a pas de secret pour vous ?

Que vous commenciez votre carrière professionnelle ou que vous soyez spécialiste de l’une de ces disciplines, intégrer notre communauté Data, c’est l’assurance de progresser, innover, partager, vous certifier et rendre service à nos clients.

Si vous souhaitez intégrer nos équipes à Bordeaux et accompagner les plus grands acteurs du secteur bancaire, cette annonce est susceptible de vous intéresser.

En tant que Data Analyst dans le secteur bancaire, votre rôle principal sera d'analyser et d'interpréter des données pour fournir des informations stratégiques et opérationnelles permettant d'améliorer la prise de décision et la performance de l'entreprise.

Fonctions et responsabilités

Vos responsabilités seront les suivantes:

-Collecter et Préparer les données provenant de diverses sources internes et externes.

-Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données en nettoyant et en transformant les données brutes.

-Analyser les données

-Créer des Tableaux de Bord et Rapports

-Analyser les Performances

-Surveiller des Tendances du Marché

En rejoignant CGI, vous bénéficiez notamment d’une offre complète de formations (techniques, métiers, développement personnel,…), de flexibilité grâce à notre accord télétravail (jusqu’à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine), d’une politique de congés avantageuse (27 jours de congés payés, RTT, congés ancienneté et enfant malade,…) et d’un package d’avantages intéressant (régime d’achats d’actions, participation, CSE,...).

Qualités requises pour réussir dans ce rôle :




Ayant une première expérience en Data, vous maitrisez les technologies suivantes :

-Solides compétences en modélisation de données

-Expérience avec les outils de Business Intelligence tels que :

Data Vizualisation (Tableau, Power BI)
ETL (Talend, Datastage, Informatica)
Reporting (SAP BO)
Qlik Sense / Qlik View

CGI est un employeur inclusif et attentif aux candidatures des personnes en situation de handicap, à l’évolution de carrières des hommes et des femmes et au bien-être de nos salariés LGBT+. Dans un souci d’accessibilité et de clarté, le point médian n’est pas utilisé dans cette annonce. Tous les termes employés se réfèrent aussi bien au genre féminin que masculin.

Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst F/H


Big Data, Data Science, Data analyse, Data architecture ... Ça n’a pas de secret pour vous ?

Que vous commenciez votre carrière professionnelle ou que vous soyez spécialiste de l’une de ces disciplines, intégrer notre communauté Data, c’est l’assurance de progresser, innover, partager, vous certifier et rendre service à nos clients.

Si vous souhaitez intégrer nos équipes à Bordeaux et accompagner les plus grands acteurs du secteur bancaire, cette annonce est susceptible de vous intéresser.

En tant que Data Analyst dans le secteur bancaire, votre rôle principal sera d'analyser et d'interpréter des données pour fournir des informations stratégiques et opérationnelles permettant d'améliorer la prise de décision et la performance de l'entreprise.

Fonctions et responsabilités

Vos responsabilités seront les suivantes:

-Collecter et Préparer les données provenant de diverses sources internes et externes.

-Assurer la qualité et la fiabilité des données en nettoyant et en transformant les données brutes.

-Analyser les données

-Créer des Tableaux de Bord et Rapports

-Analyser les Performances

-Surveiller des Tendances du Marché

En rejoignant CGI, vous bénéficiez notamment d’une offre complète de formations (techniques, métiers, développement personnel,…), de flexibilité grâce à notre accord télétravail (jusqu’à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine), d’une politique de congés avantageuse (27 jours de congés payés, RTT, congés ancienneté et enfant malade,…) et d’un package d’avantages intéressant (régime d’achats d’actions, participation, CSE,...).

Qualités requises pour réussir dans ce rôle :


Ayant une première expérience en Data, vous maitrisez les technologies suivantes :

-Solides compétences en modélisation de données

-Expérience avec les outils de Business Intelligence tels que :

  • Data Vizualisation (Tableau, Power BI)
  • ETL (Talend, Datastage, Informatica)
  • Reporting (SAP BO)
  • Qlik Sense / Qlik View

CGI est un employeur inclusif et attentif aux candidatures des personnes en situation de handicap, à l’évolution de carrières des hommes et des femmes et au bien-être de nos salariés LGBT+. Dans un souci d’accessibilité et de clarté, le point médian n’est pas utilisé dans cette annonce. Tous les termes employés se réfèrent aussi bien au genre féminin que masculin.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Senior BI Analyst with a background in Financial Services. The candidate in this role will be involved in project governance, cost management and reporting to senior leaders across operational and transformation programmes. Key responsibilities include overseeing revenue generating initiatives, managing budgets and tracking performance. The ideal candidate is organised, detail-oriented, and able to manage tasks across multiple teams.




Requirements :

Strong experience using Power BI, and data analyst tools.
Experience developing and refining templates, dashboards, and reports.
Budgeting and financial reporting experience.
Ability to perform in-depth data analysis across key operational areas, including interpreting complex data sets to deliver actionable insights.
Experience working with stakeholders and delivering reports to multiple teams.
Background working in Financial Services - Asset Management, Funds.

The candidate in this role will be involved in project governance, cost management and reporting to senior leaders across operational and transformation programmes. Key responsibilities include overseeing revenue generating initiatives, managing budgets and tracking performance. The ideal candidate is organised, detail-oriented, and able to manage tasks across multiple teams.


Requirements :

  1. Strong experience using Power BI, and data analyst tools.
  2. Experience developing and refining templates, dashboards, and reports.
  3. Budgeting and financial reporting experience.
  4. Ability to perform in-depth data analysis across key operational areas, including interpreting complex data sets to deliver actionable insights.
  5. Experience working with stakeholders and delivering reports to multiple teams.
  6. Background working in Financial Services - Asset Management, Funds.

Title: Data Analyst Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
Line of Service

Tax

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

Data, Analytics & AI

Management Level

Associate

Job Description & Summary

PwC Luxembourg is hiring a Data Analyst Specialist M/F/D. What if it was you?

Who we are: We are the largest professional services firm in Luxembourg, providing audit, tax and advisory services including management consulting, transaction, financing and regulatory advice to a wide variety of clients. To make it happen, we count on the expertise of over 3,700 people from more than 94 different countries, who strive every day to reach excellence and team up to solve important problems through innovative solutions. We value diverse and singular career paths, embrace everyone's unique self and encourage our People to fuel their potential in a work environment that is inclusive, stimulating, and motivating.

Your mission:


Be involved in transformation and automation projects from end-to-end (analysis, design, set-up, training, communication, …);
Identify, initiate, and drive business solutions using data technologies;
Work closely with stakeholders, understand the business requirements, prioritise and translate the client’s requirements into functional and technical specifications. Our activity Business requirement Understanding – Process, data analysis, data cleansing and dashboarding
Process Understanding and applying with the support of the business analyst the dataflow, the internal process of end-users.
Data analysis, data cleansing and dashboarding
Understanding internal system constraints;
Working closely with stakeholders to analyse, identify and prioritise business requirements;
Orchestrating data collection from databases or other sources;
Interpreting data, analysing results and providing ongoing reports;
Modelling data related to specific business objectives, interpreting trends and patterns in complex data sets;
Communicating effectively the results of our analysis and discussing the subsequent action plan with the stakeholders;
Following weekly on the transformation roadmap with the other team members;
Looking for new business opportunities, developing your own ideas, and implementing proof of concepts to test their feasibility.


Let’s talk about you. If you are/have:


Graduated with a University degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, IT Technology or Business Administration with an IT focus;
Seeking experience in an international environment
IT driven and have knowledge on Excel and Word. SQL, XML and data loading processes knowledge is a plus;
ITIL and/or Agile know-how is a plus;
Knowledge on Data visualization tools is a plus (such as Power BI, Qlikview…);
A team player and a strong motivation
Documentations and analytical skills, curiosity and proactivity that will guide you to success in your assignments;
A good command of French and English, our two main working languages. Any additional language would be an asset (German, Luxembourgish...)


Moreover, our recruitment process is short and simple:


A technical interview with a business recruiter
An interview with a Talent Acquisition Specialist to assess your motivation
An interview with a Partner of the team, if relevant.


A final word about us: At PwC, we believe diversity is the representation of all the characteristics that make us both alike and unique. Our backgrounds, cultures, nationalities, lifestyles, identities, opinions and beliefs, approaches to solving problems, ways of working, and views of personal and professional

success, all add value to the services we deliver to our clients. Our objective is to nurture an inclusive environment where a diversity mindset is ingrained, and inclusion is the norm. We constantly focus on respecting and valuing individual differences.

Ready to grow your potential, reaching excellence together? Apply to the position now!

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
A propos de JEMS

Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…

Vos missions

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst confirmé(e) capable d'accompagner les métiers dans l'aide à la décision.

Vous aurez la charge de :


Guider / recommander le Métier dans l’exploitation et la valorisation des multiples sources de données et identifier des leviers d’optimisation et d’amélioration des processus Business
Être l‘intermédiaire entre le Métier et la DSI
Accroître la connaissance de la clientèle d’une entreprise, conduire des études sur les bases de données, suivre les outils datamining pour analyser l’impact des actions marketing
Mener et conduire des études (coordination/pilotage)


Vos compétences

En tant que Data Analyst vous maitrisez :


MS Office
Le requêtage SQL
Des outils BI Fonction Expertise sur les données du Métier
Des solutions Analytiques (Data Science ou Data Mining / BI)
Des outils de datavisualisation
La préparation de données


Votre profil

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur ou d’un parcours universitaire technique. Vous justifiez d’au minimum de quatre ans d’expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Analyst.

Avantages à travailler chez JEMS


Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)
Une entreprise reconnue "Great Place To Work"
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales


Mobilité

Une mobilité nationale et internationale pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de vie.

Diversité

Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur "Diversité" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

Learn and familiarize oneself with automation tools such as EDI and Esker through guided training sessions and self-directed learning.

Support the implementation of new configurations of the tools through master data uploads, testing and documenting best practices with careful supervision from the order management team.

Collaborate with cross functional teams to translate new functionality or feedback on support requests.

Explore the adaptation of AI related to order management to improve process and gain efficiencies.

Data analysis of customers' order entry history and support requests, to build customers' digital profile and segmentation of different clusters

Provide custom-made solutions/paths to improve automation level and efficiency of his order-to-cash process in alignment with customer's sustainability goals.

Skills:

Enrolled in a Bachelors or Master degree program, Engineering, Information Systems or computer science

Strong interest in automation technologies and willingness to learn new tools and concepts.

Self-starter: ability to effectively prioritize, manage multiple tasks and complete assigned tasks with minimal direct supervision.

Effective communication and interpersonal skills, ability to collaborate with team members.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical users orally and in written format.

Keen attention to detail and accurate data entry.

Language required: Fluent English

Sharp, fast learner with a curiosity and aptitude for technical learning.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Cognism is a market leader in international sales intelligence. Access to our premium data, has helped a wide variety of global revenue teams change their approach to prospecting, resulting in predictable and prosperous outcomes.

Following multiple successful funding rounds and the acquisition of Mailtastic (2020), an email signature solution provider, and Kaspr (2022), a Paris-based sales prospecting tool, there has never been a more exciting time to join us.

As we grow, one of our main objectives is to continue hiring individuals, who are both a professional and cultural fit for our Company. Our values are at the core of everything we do!

Our people;


Are Nice!
Are Collaborative. We’re in this together!
Are Solution-Focused. For every problem, we’ve got a solution!
Are Understanding.
Celebrate Individual Contributors.


We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive global workplace, which encourages you to achieve any goals you may have, while having fun along the way!

About The Role

We have a new exciting position open for the role of Senior Data Analyst.

We are looking for someone with 5+ years of experience in Data Analytics that will be responsible for modelling data to provide clean, accurate datasets so that different users within the company can work with them. The role entails transforming, testing, and documenting data.

Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Interpretation:


Work with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and data requirements.
Utilize SQL, Spark, and other relevant tools to extract, clean, and analyze large datasets efficiently.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights and present them in a clear and concise manner.


Business Intelligence


Analyze historical data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Support ad-hoc data requests and provide insightful analysis to support various business initiatives.


Process Improvement


Identify opportunities to streamline data-related processes and improve efficiency.
Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to enhance data infrastructure and ensure smooth data flow.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a track record of handling complex datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and querying.
Proficiency in Spark for handling and processing large-scale data sets.
Knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and data pipeline concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment.


We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con experiencia en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de análisis de datos.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y estén listos para el análisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




REQUISITOS

Experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Dominio de DAX para crear cálculos y medidas.
Experiencia con Power Query para la transformación y preparación de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación como Python, o R.
Conocimiento de BBDD SQL y Excel.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Show more

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us:




We are a product and technology company working with the rising stars and established leaders of iGaming industry. On a good day of the week we have enough players to fill the biggest sports arenas in the world. We welcome ambitious professionals to join "Kickertech" - a modern and creative IT company uniting technology and results-driven professionals who strive to deliver world-class products to their customers.




Now we are looking for a new Data Analyst to join our big family!




Job Responsibilities:




• Build analysis, data visualizations, and multi-functional reporting using Tableau that provides critical support to the operations and decision-making of the organization.

• Use internal and external analytics tools, SQL, and scripting languages to access and analyze multivariate data.

• Exploring and developing innovative ways to visualize value-based care financial reporting.

• Provide analytics expertise to key business partners regarding data & analytics questions.

• Take personal accountability for delivery of projects and committed timelines.

• Support business partners in adopting reporting solutions and business intelligence tools for self-service.

• Build effective working relationships with team members.




Required Qualifications:




• 2+ years of experience working with large data sets, reporting and dashboards.

• 1+ years experience using Tableau.

• Expert SQL skills for complex querying, analysis, performance optimization, and persisting data.

• Understanding of data warehousing concepts, design, modeling, and data engineering.

• Solid skills in visualizing data.

• Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills.

• Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.

• Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks.




Preferred Qualifications:




• Experience in iGaming industry.

• Python experience writing, managing, and deploying code.

• Effective presentation skills.

• Ability to work remotely as well as in-office.




Working with us implies:




• Competitive base salary and other benefits, including health insurance and employee referral program.

• Memorable company parties and social activities like team buildings and monthly birthday celebrations.

• New modern, bright, and comfortable office space in the center of Vilnius, with a great working atmosphere, in a collaborative team of amazing people, with forward-thinking managers.

• Free parking for your car or motorcycle and showers if you prefer to cycle to work.

• Opportunities to build valuable skills, work with unique and interesting projects for the sports industry, express and implement your ideas and grow your career!




Monthly salary range for this position: € 3000 - 4000 (before tax deduction). The final offer will depend on the experience and competencies of the selected candidate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Analyst to join us!




Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.




We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.




Our values

We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!




What you will do




The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.




You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.




Responsibilities




Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework




Qualifications




Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
Experience with DBT.
Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing




Perks & Benefits at Tiqets




Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
Pension scheme and travel compensation
Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
Hybrid working model
Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
Reimbursement home workspace necessities




Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

Title: Data Analyst - biosignal analysis
Description:
Are you interested in developing new healthcare technology targeted to international markets, further developing new products with a talented and ambitious team? Do you find it motivating to work on a meaningful job helping people suffering severe chronic conditions and enable the healthcare system to better serve those in need. Adamant Health is now looking for a person to work as an data analyst and scientist and to help the company to realise its vision.




Adamant Health Oy is looking for:




Data analyst & scientist




Job type: Full-time (permanent) or part-time (worktime 50% or more)

Location: Finland

Languages: English, Finnish, German (bonus)

Start-date: Immediately or as agreed

Place of work: Hybrid, preferably in Kuopio or Helsinki region

Company: Adamant Health Oy

Application deadline: 31.10.2024 (recruitment will be done once a suitable candidate is found)




Adamant Health is a Finnish healthcare technology start-up and spin-off from the University of Eastern Finland. Our mission is to help people with Parkinson’s disease and other movement disorders by bringing new data driven treatment practices into the way people are treated and medicated. Adamant Health stands out from the competition with its unique technology based on extensive academic research and medical device status (CE marked). The company was founded in August 2020 and has 15 professionals working in Helsinki, Kuopio, Oulu, Tampere and Turku regions.




Adamant Health is growing and entering a new phase in its journey, and we are now looking for a person to work as a data analyst and scientist for the company. In this role you will analyse the data measured from the patient with our leading measurement and analysis service and create symptom reports used by our customers. Another key task is to further develop our service, the advanced algorithms used and work closely together with our Chief Scientist and co-founder Saara Rissanen, PhD and Docent. We are looking for a person who is enthusiastic about learning and growing into the role for those aspects which still may be new for you. As part of the team, you will have a unique opportunity to build the number one company in providing data driven Parkinson’s treatment.




You will succeed in this position with prior experience in signal processing and analysis preferably related to human neurophysiology. You have expertise in algorithm development and experience in programming with Matlab. You are good in documenting and communicating your work results in English. Prior experience related to movement disorders, machine learning, utilising AI in data analysis, familiarity with medical device development and co-writing scientific articles are considered as a plus.




Key responsibilities of the role include:

Performing data analysis on neurophysiological, motion and patient reported outcome data and produce analysis results and reports for customers.
Participate in further development of the algorithms and data analysis automation.
Support customer cases and projects
Participate in clinical and case study project planning and execution




If you think you are at your best when working in a dynamic start-up environment and you want to have a strong purpose and meaningful job in a team developing healthcare technology for a better tomorrow, this is a great opportunity for you.




To be successful in this role you have:

Master’s degree or close to graduate in relevant topics such as medical physics, medical engineering, or medical technology.
Relevant work experience with biosignal analysis is considered a plus
Prior experience with algorithm development and data analysis using Matlab is mandatory and with Python is considered a plus
Prior experience with Atlassian (Jira & Confluence) tools is considered a plus.
Genuine interest to work in a healthcare start-up.
Motivated to ramp-up new and succeed in a job with wide range of responsibilities and ambition to learn continuously.
Professional in English, as the main working language. Finnish and German considered a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as in a team, combined with good communication and social skills.




Why you should join Adamant Health:

A meaningful job and opportunity to work for improving people lives and for better healthcare
Work with a diverse team of experts with various backgrounds
Freedom to arrange and organise your work
A chance to be a part of a dynamic start-up team aiming high




If you feel that you are the right person for the job with a matching background and experience, please send your application and CV ASAP via LinkedIn. Please include your salary expectations and your first possible start date.




www.adamanthealth.com

  • Freedom to arrange and organise your work
  • A chance to be a part of a dynamic start-up team aiming high


If you feel that you are the right person for the job with a matching background and experience, please send your application and CV ASAP via LinkedIn. Please include your salary expectations and your first possible start date.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.


Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.




Job Description



As part of a larger Data Team, your primary responsibility will be managing our Unit4 FP&A tool alongside two colleagues. Unit4 FP&A is a comprehensive software solution designed to streamline financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and analytical processes, helping organizations achieve optimal financial performance at a reduced cost.


You will be responsible for collecting, transforming, and modeling data, building reports and dashboards, and ensuring all outputs align with our business goals and financial objectives.


The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of business processes, system integration, and technical troubleshooting, while demonstrating strong collaboration and communication skills with multiple stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities:


Analyze, identify, and resolve data quality and integrity issues with strong attention to detail.
Translate business requirements into data-driven solutions to improve financial operations.
Create, maintain, and enhance reports, dashboards, and data visualizations using Unit4 FP&A.
Develop and maintain well-organized data models for efficient analysis.
Integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow across systems and departments.
Provide technical support and training to end users while troubleshooting and resolving data or system issues.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Technology, Data Analytics).
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, including experience in complex database development, reporting, and automation.
Familiarity with CRM (preferably Dynamics CRM) and ERP systems. Expertise in Power BI or similar BI tools is a plus.
Strong communication skills in English, with excellent stakeholder management abilities.
Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes.
Proficiency in cleaning, preprocessing, and organizing raw data.
Expertise in visualization tools like Power BI or similar.
Ability to create clear, insightful, and visually engaging reports, charts, and graphs.
Skilled in communicating complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficient in database systems with the ability to write complex queries.
Experience working with relational and cloud data platforms (e.g., MS SQL, Snowflake).
Ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating across departments.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to clearly convey findings.
Capability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines efficiently.
Strong prioritization skills to focus on the most critical analyses.
Ability to keep up-to-date with the latest trends in data analytics and financial reporting tools.
Proactive in seeking opportunities for skill development and technical advancements.
Adhering to data privacy regulations and upholding ethical standards in all aspects of data handling.

Office: Lisbon, expected onsite presence 2-3 days a week.




Additional Information



Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us.


At Unit4, we offer:


a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.
Show more

  • a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,

Title: Data Analyst (SQL)
Description:
AppXite is a product software development company, based in Riga, Latvia. Our Platform empowers sellers, distributors, and vendors transforming into a subscription- and consumption-based businesses. It decreases human touchpoints and lowers transaction costs throughout the entire customer journey with automation and self-service. We have years of experience in the SaaS and software markets and long-term working relationships with the largest vendors in the world (e.g. Microsoft, IBM, AWS, Google, Adobe, Cisco etc.). Our platform enables the software and cloud service businesses of household names like Atea, Liquid and Lenovo.




As a Data Analyst, you will support the billing and invoicing, reporting, and integration functions in the AppXite Platform. You will be working with MS SQL server through MS SQL Server Management Studio (write and execute scripts). Make API calls to different systems like MS Partner Center, AWS, Google, etc using Postman. You will be working with Excel, using advanced functionality for data analysis. In the future, you should be able to write your own functions to automate processes.




Your mission:

Gathering the correct data required to complete each file.
Verification of invoice data across multiple resources.
Perform data analysis to identify potential errors.
Make any manual corrections/fixes if needed in order to deliver reconciliation files on time.
Bug fixing.
Produce reconciliation files using our internal tool.
Ensure delivery of this reconciliation file to the correct recipient – customer or internal.
Review the reconciliation process and seek continual improvement.
Help detail development tasks required to implement improvements to this process.
Consult for support & internal team on questions relating to invoices and data.
Performing investigations when required to help resolve any problems.




That’s you:

On-hands experience with SQL scripting (advanced level!).
Understand and can work with APIs.
Extremely comfortable with large Excel spreadsheets.
Able to maintain focus for long periods of time.
Responsible and dedicated to making things work by coming up with solutions.
Goal-oriented and accurate.
Flexible, adaptable, versatile, and stress-resistant.
Ability to work as part of a team.
Extremely detail-oriented and very well organized.
Able to work on your own initiative and find solutions.
Passionate about the quality of work.




Why join AppXite?

Collaborate with industry giants like Microsoft, Lenovo, Atea, Adobe, AWS, Cisco, Google, IBM, and more, as we partner with some of the largest companies in the industry.
Engage yourself in a diverse and international work environment, surrounded by skilled colleagues.
Enhance your expertise through professional training programs. We provide Microsoft certification. Broaden your knowledge and stay up-to-date with the latest trends.
We offer medical insurance coverage.
Stay connected without worrying about your mobile phone bill, as we take care of it for you.
Embrace flexibility with remote work options, allowing you to achieve a healthy work-life balance.
Benefit from our employee referral program and enjoy rewarding opportunities by referring talented individuals to our team.




Join us at AppXite and be a part of our dynamic team!

Show more

Title: BI Data Analyst (Tableau Reporting)
HTML:
Perfect match for this role would be person who has good practice with Tableau reporting, good organisational and management skills. First of all needed to get rid of mess with Tableau reports published on our tableau site (different filters, unused sheets, broken actions, reports with poor visualisation, missing reports description). Next step, make description in Confluence for dashboards with missing one (Scope of report, main metrics, formulas of calculations).

Also there would be monthly recurring task of preparing some simple reports for board meetings (updating the workbooks, analysing difference, making conclusions, updating presentation from previous month with new results).

At the start of this role theres no need in strong SQL or advanced math skills, so good knowledges of Tableau products and Excel\Gogle Sheets would be enough. You will get full support of team members at any stage of completing your tasks, we guarantee comprehensive onboarding, any-time calls for any questions, all your test period tasks you will complete in collaboration with BI team members.

Requirements

  • 1Y+ experience of Tableau products (creating, publishing dashboards, LOD expressions, good visualisation skills);
  • Basic SQL skills for typical analytical purposes;
  • Supporting operational units with automating routine using Google Sheets(Excel books) or integrate own experience;
  • Be familiar with product metrics, retention, LTV;
  • Ability to describe complex topics in a simple terminology;
  • Upper-Intermediate level of spoken and written English;
  • Gambling industry or Big4 work records - are great plus


Responsibilities

  • Administrating and managing reports, users, roles on Tableau site;
  • Preparing dashboards and visualisations to highlight main risks and possibilities for business;
  • Making conclusions and presenting result to responsible business unit;
  • Be involved into designing new game features and upgrading old ones;
  • Describing reports

As a plus

  • Bachelor degree in Economics and/or STEM degree are welcomed;
  • Experience with the online gambling industry domain, B2B business type and Big4 records would be great plus;
  • Practical experience with workflow management tools (Jira), collaboration software (Confluence)


Benefits

  • 🎰 Join us to be a part the international iGaming market of a Top European solution provider;
  • 💰 A nice bonus system as a cool addition to your salary ;
  • 📆 Unlimited vacation and sick leave. Yes, we care about people;
  • 📈 Investing in your growth. You have a budget for self-study;
  • 🏥 Healthcare coverage for Ukrainian and other EU countries;
  • 🫂 Consultations with a corporate psychologist;
  • 🇬🇧 Compensation for foreign language courses;
  • 🎁 Gifts for personal life events;
  • ☕️ With us, you will no longer see hyper-control and micromanagement;
  • 🏢 You can choose work format: fully remote, office or hybrid
  • 🖥 Modern work equipment;
  • 🚚 Support of relocation to our hubs;
  • 💕 Friendly team, that will understand and support you;
  • ⏳ Flexible working hours based on tasks completion. From 9:00-11:00 AM;
  • 🇺🇦 Glory to Ukraine!

Learn and familiarize oneself with automation tools such as EDI and Esker through guided training sessions and self-directed learning.

Collaborate with cross functional teams to translate new functionality or feedback on support requests.

Explore the adaptation of AI related to order management to improve process and gain efficiencies.

Data analysis of customers' order entry history and support requests, to build customers' digital profile and segmentation of different clusters

Provide custom-made solutions/paths to improve automation level and efficiency of his order-to-cash process in alignment with customer's sustainability goals.

Strong interest in automation technologies and willingness to learn new tools and concepts.

Self-starter: ability to effectively prioritize, manage multiple tasks and complete assigned tasks with minimal direct supervision.

Effective communication and interpersonal skills, ability to collaborate with team members.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical users orally and in written format.

Keen attention to detail and accurate data entry.

Language required: Fluent English

Sharp, fast learner with a curiosity and aptitude for technical learning.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Cognism is a market leader in international sales intelligence. Access to our premium data, has helped a wide variety of global revenue teams change their approach to prospecting, resulting in predictable and prosperous outcomes.

Following multiple successful funding rounds and the acquisition of Mailtastic (2020), an email signature solution provider, and Kaspr (2022), a Paris-based sales prospecting tool, there has never been a more exciting time to join us.

As we grow, one of our main objectives is to continue hiring individuals, who are both a professional and cultural fit for our Company. Our values are at the core of everything we do!

Our people;


Are Nice!
Are Collaborative. We’re in this together!
Are Solution-Focused. For every problem, we’ve got a solution!
Are Understanding.
Celebrate Individual Contributors.


We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive global workplace, which encourages you to achieve any goals you may have, while having fun along the way!

About The Role

We have a new exciting position open for the role of Senior Data Analyst.

We are looking for someone with 5+ years of experience in Data Analytics that will be responsible for modelling data to provide clean, accurate datasets so that different users within the company can work with them. The role entails transforming, testing, and documenting data.

Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Interpretation:


Work with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and data requirements.
Utilize SQL, Spark, and other relevant tools to extract, clean, and analyze large datasets efficiently.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights and present them in a clear and concise manner.


Business Intelligence


Analyze historical data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Support ad-hoc data requests and provide insightful analysis to support various business initiatives.


Process Improvement


Identify opportunities to streamline data-related processes and improve efficiency.
Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to enhance data infrastructure and ensure smooth data flow.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a track record of handling complex datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and querying.
Proficiency in Spark for handling and processing large-scale data sets.
Knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and data pipeline concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment.


We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Company: IRCA Group is a leading international B2B provider of semi-finished ingredients for the bakery, pastry, and gelato markets. Our products cater to independent producers as well as large food manufacturers. We produce chocolate, decorations, creams, inclusions, pastry mixes, gelato ingredients, and other bakery/pastry essentials. Headquartered in Italy, IRCA Group boasts a strong track record of growth over the past decade, with 22 manufacturing facilities all over the world, 2000+ employee and €1 billion of revenues.

What we offer: IRCA fosters a dynamic environment, embracing diversity and valuing diverse perspectives and international experiences, offering a stimulating context. We promote professional growth by providing tailor-made development programs and career advancement opportunities locally and internationally. With locations worldwide, we offer the chance to work on international projects, collaborate across cultures, and gain a global perspective. Joining our team means becoming part of a global community of passionate professionals dedicated to making a difference. If you are looking for stimulating challenges and the chance to contribute your ideas for process improvement in an ever-growing company, IRCA is the right place.

Purpose of Position: We are currently looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst Intern to join our Demand Planning team in the Supply Chain department.

Description Of Main Activities/Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze data related to sales forecasts, inventory, and supply chain processes.
Assist in the development and maintenance of demand forecasting models.
Identify trends and patterns in data to help optimize inventory management and improve forecasting accuracy.
Support the team in creating dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Sales, Supply Chain, Marketing) to provide data-driven insights for decision making.
Assist in ad-hoc data analysis projects as needed.


Requirements


Education:Data Science/Analyst, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or a related field.
Professional Skills:Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Language Skills:Proficiency in Italian and English is mandatory
Computer Skills:Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel (pivot tables, etc.) and/or statistical tools like Python, R, or SQL.
Behavioural Requirements: Excellent communication and relational and problem-solving skills. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.


We welcome applications from candidates of all genders, backgrounds, identities, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. We believe in equal opportunities for all and ensure that our hiring process complies with the highest standards of non-discrimination and inclusivity. IRCA Group is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone can be their authentic selves, reach their full potential, and feel a true sense of belonging. Join us in creating a workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone can thrive.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D.lgs . 198/2006 e ai candidati appartenenti a qualsiasi genere, nel rispetto dei principi di diversità e inclusione e di non discriminazione.

  • Assist in ad-hoc data analysis projects as needed.

Requirements

  • Education:Data Science/Analyst, Statistics, Economics, Business, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Professional Skills:Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Language Skills:Proficiency in Italian and English is mandatory
  • Computer Skills:Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel (pivot tables, etc.) and/or statistical tools like Python, R, or SQL.
  • Behavioural Requirements: Excellent communication and relational and problem-solving skills. Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

We welcome applications from candidates of all genders, backgrounds, identities, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. We believe in equal opportunities for all and ensure that our hiring process complies with the highest standards of non-discrimination and inclusivity. IRCA Group is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone can be their authentic selves, reach their full potential, and feel a true sense of belonging. Join us in creating a workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone can thrive.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D.lgs . 198/2006 e ai candidati appartenenti a qualsiasi genere, nel rispetto dei principi di diversità e inclusione e di non discriminazione.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con experiencia en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de análisis de datos.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y estén listos para el análisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




REQUISITOS

Experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Dominio de DAX para crear cálculos y medidas.
Experiencia con Power Query para la transformación y preparación de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación como Python, o R.
Conocimiento de BBDD SQL y Excel.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
En Tenth Revolution somos expertos en consultoría tecnológica y gestión de proyectos IT, con una base de clientes en SAP muy desarrollada.




Para este proyecto, estamos colaborando con la mayor empresa a nivel eruopeo del sector siderúrgico de capital español ubicado en la zona de Barcelona.

Esta compañía industrial con presencia en todo el sur de Europa, Países Nórdicos, Polonia, Francia, Suecia y Reino Unido cuenta con cerca de 10.000 empleados y tiene diversos grupos epresariales con productos de aceros, laminación, plantas de traformacion y recivlaje y empresas de distribución.




Actualmente buscamos un/a consultor Data Analyst con experiencia en Power BI, para incorporarse al equipo de tecnología y sostenibilidad dentro del cliente.




Requisitos:

Experienia trabajando con Power BI.
Excel avanzado.
Capacidad analítica
Power Point
Nivel de inglés mínimo B2.
Soft skills: versátil, con iniciativa propia y, por supuesto, capacidad de análisis.
Vehículo propio.




Funciones principales:

Análisis de datos con Power Bi y con MS Excel para brindar apoyo al departamento.
Colaborar directamente con el equipo de negocio para identificar oportunidades de mejora y apoyar en la implementación de nuevas iniciativas
Participar en proyectos y actividades del Departamento de Sostenibilidad, obteniendo una visión amplia del funcionamiento del área.




Condiciones:

Horario: de 9 a 18h, jornada intensiva los viernes.
Modalidad de trabajo híbrido.
Banda salarial flexible en función de la experiencia y conocimientos.
Contrato indefinido y proyecto estable.
Comedor gratuito
Parking en las instalaciones.




Si te parece interesante, ¿hablamos? p.hernando@tenthrevolution.com

Show more

Title: Analista de datos Power BI
Description:
Formación Académica

• Ciclo Formativo de Grado Superior, deseable Ingeniería Técnica Informática

• Grado en Ciencia de datos




Conocimientos y experiencia:

• Al menos tres años de experiencia como Data Analyst Power BI con sólidos conocimientos en ingeniería de datos




Conocimientos/Certificaciones necesarios:

• Power BI

• Microsoft Fabric

• Data Factory

• SQL

• Metodologías Agile (Scrum / Kanban)

• Autonomía en la ejecución de tareas

• Proactividad para identificar mejoras

• Uso de las mejores prácticas en los desarrollos.

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Description:
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$57 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #248 in the Fortune Global 500, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver Smarter Technology for All, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company with a full-stack portfolio of AI-enabled, AI-ready, and AI-optimized devices (PCs, workstations, smartphones, tablets), infrastructure (server, storage, edge, high performance computing and software defined infrastructure), software, solutions, and services. Lenovo’s continued investment in world-changing innovation is building a more equitable, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange under Lenovo Group Limited (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY).

This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

In this role, you will support and develop best-in-class analytics and reporting capabilities across EMEA for Lenovo, working closely with strategic business analyst teams. You will drive actionable insights and data intelligence across regions, providing critical information to key stakeholders. This is an excellent opportunity to influence and enhance analytics capabilities across the region.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and Maintain Reporting Solutions: Collaborate with strategic business analyst teams and other stakeholders to build comprehensive reporting solutions using Power BI, Excel, Tableau, Qlik, and SQL, incorporating multiple data sources such as chat, call, and sales data.
Data Analysis and Insight Generation: Utilize multi-source data to identify actionable insights and trends, enabling sales teams and managers to enhance performance and resolve potential issues proactively.
Real-Time Data Collaboration: Work closely with different teams across Lenovo and other GEOs to ensure real-time data availability and accuracy for EMEA eCommerce.
Performance Tracking: Monitor and track the performance of Inside Sales Representatives, including sales performance, conversion rates, activity levels, and attachment rates, providing regular feedback and insights.
Forecasting and Trend Analysis: Use data analysis to assist in forecasting trends and identifying opportunities for upselling and cross-selling within the eCommerce space.
Stakeholder Communication: Clearly communicate complex data insights to key stakeholders, ensuring data is presented in a way that drives informed decision-making.
Project Involvement: Represent EMEA eCommerce teams in various projects, contributing data intelligence and analytics expertise to support project goals.
Reporting Coordination: Work closely with the reporting team to bring data insights to life, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and relevance in all reporting outputs.


Qualifications


Experience: Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably within data agencies, technology suppliers, or call centers, with a strong understanding of eCommerce analytics.
Technical Skills: Proficient in Power BI, Excel, Tableau, Qlik, and SQL, with proven experience in developing dashboards and reports to support data-driven decision-making.
Data Management: Solid experience working with and analyzing big data in a workforce management context, ensuring insights are actionable and relevant.
Analytical Mindset: Highly organized, with a strong analytics mentality, inquisitive about customer behavior, and capable of generating valuable insights from data.
Communication Skills: Exceptional presentation and communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data themes clearly to stakeholders.
Stakeholder Management: Comfortable engaging with stakeholders at all levels, demonstrating the ability to influence and communicate effectively.
Proactive and Self-Motivated: Demonstrates a positive "can do" attitude, with the ability to work independently and proactively in a fast-paced environment.
Language Skills: Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication abilities.


What Can We Offer


Life Insurance
Meal Vouchers
Employee Referral Bonus
Lenovo and Motorola Product Discounts
Employee Assistance Program, e.g., for health, legal financial consultancy
Internal E-learning Development Platform Available for Employees


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

  • Lenovo and Motorola Product Discounts
  • Employee Assistance Program, e.g., for health, legal financial consultancy
  • Internal E-learning Development Platform Available for Employees

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Title: Marketing Data Analist (junior)
Description:
Ben jij iemand die enthousiast wordt van marketing data? Iemand die uit diverse data de juiste inzichten kan halen? En heb je ervaring met Excel en PowerBI? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Bij Dunck Loyalty in Utrecht krijg je als Marketing Data Analist een unieke kans om jouw analytische vaardigheden volledig in te zetten. Je gaat aan de slag met een breed scala aan projecten voor A-merk opdrachtgevers – van verenigingen en goede doelen tot commerciële B2B- en B2C-bedrijven. Geen dag is hetzelfde!




Wat ga je doen?

Als Marketing Data Analist bij Dunck Loyalty duik je in de wereld van klantdata. Jij weet hoe je uit grote hoeveelheden marketing data de juiste inzichten haalt en deze aansprekend en begrijpelijk weergeeft in PowerPoint en/of PowerBI.




Je dagelijkse werkzaamheden bestaan uit:

Meedenken over relevante klantdata-analyses en dashboards voor onze toonaangevende opdrachtgevers
Uitvoeren van complexe klantdata-analyses in Excel, SPSS, PowerBI
Ontwikkelen, uitbreiden en updaten van loyalty dashboards en marketing programma dashboards in PowerBI
Ondersteunen bij de uitvoering van kwantitatieve (en evt. kwalitatieve) marketing onderzoeken
Vertalen van diverse inzichten naar concrete conclusies en aanbevelingen
Bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling en standaardisatie van insights oplossingen




Wat neem je mee?

Een studie op Universitair niveau in een relevante richting
Tot 5 jaar werkervaring
Een passie voor data en een scherp oog voor detail
Het vermogen om uit grote hoeveelheden data de juiste inzichten te halen
Ervaring met Excel en PowerBI (eventueel ook met SPSS)
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Energie en doorzettingsvermogen




Wat bieden we jou?

Een hele leuke en uitdagende baan bij dé toonaangevende partij in Nederland op het gebied van Loyalty Marketing. Je salaris is aantrekkelijk en sluit aan bij de kennis en ervaring die je meebrengt.




Secundaire voorwaarden o.a.:

Ruimte en aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling door opleiding, coaching, literatuur, events en inspiratie vanuit collega’s
Een professionele en informele werksfeer met gezamenlijke lunches, inspiratiesessies en borrels
Veel ruimte om je professionele netwerk uit te breiden en jezelf te ontwikkelen als expert op het gebied van loyalty en marketing insights




Dunck bestaat uit een team van gedreven marketing professionals. We zijn trots op wat we doen en hebben daar veel plezier in. Wij werken vanuit een stimulerende omgeving in Utrecht en maken grote groeistappen. Jouw energie en talent zal bij ons floreren!




Vragen of reageren?

Op de website van Dunck (www.dunck.nl) staat nog meer informatie over de vacature. Voor inhoudelijke vragen over de vacature kun je ook contact opnemen met Rob Horsten via 030-2347130. Direct solliciteren? Stuur dan je CV (en motivatie) vóór 14 oktober 2024 naar sollicitatie@dunck.nl.




Over Dunck

Dunck is gespecialiseerd en toonaangevend in Loyalty Marketing. Wij helpen onze opdrachtgevers bij het stimuleren van klantloyaliteit. Dit doen wij middels een compleet scala aan slimme en innovatieve marketingoplossingen, die wij inzetten voor vele bekende organisaties zoals Accor Hotels, Vereniging Eigen Huis, Greenpeace, FNV, Unicef, Hartstichting, DHL en ANWB.

Title: PBI Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress




We are looking for a PBI Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Help our sales partners in their decision-making-processes by creating elements in our frontend with a good visualization and storyline
Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI to provide insights to the business with a good visualization and storyline
Identify the correct data sources, updating our data models and develop the required transformations / calculations




Requirements:

Experience in the design and implementation with Microsoft Power BI, including using DAX (2y+)
Experience working with Databases (relation and non-relational), Data Structures (json, xml) and using SQL (2y+)
Experience communicating and dealing with different stakeholders
Familiarity with agile methodologies, such as SCRUM




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with the reference "VR/DA".




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


  • Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
  • Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
  • Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress


We are looking for a PBI Data Analyst!


Responsibilities:

  • Help our sales partners in their decision-making-processes by creating elements in our frontend with a good visualization and storyline
  • Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI to provide insights to the business with a good visualization and storyline
  • Identify the correct data sources, updating our data models and develop the required transformations / calculations


Requirements:

  • Experience in the design and implementation with Microsoft Power BI, including using DAX (2y+)
  • Experience working with Databases (relation and non-relational), Data Structures (json, xml) and using SQL (2y+)
  • Experience communicating and dealing with different stakeholders
  • Familiarity with agile methodologies, such as SCRUM


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with the reference "VR/DA".


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Junior Data Analyst | MySQL & PowerBI (1y contract | Remote)
HTML:
iubenda is a legal-tech scale-up founded in 2011, now trusted by over 110K clients in the EU, the US, and 100+ more Countries. We are leaders in our industry and operate on a global scale developing and releasing innovative tech solutions.
Our mission is to provide our clients with everything their business needs - to be compliant with legal, local, and regional requirements; so that they can focus on their core product. Recently, we have undertaken a new thrilling adventure, joining forces with team.blue (a worldwide leader in digital enablement). If you're excited to work at a company in a scaling-up environment providing SaaS solutions to ~1M users - and equally important - to join a team of friendly people with a culture based on continuous learning, transparency, and collaboration. Then, you're looking at the right place!


Your mission

We're looking for an enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our Finance Team and be responsible for providing support in business KPIs optimization, and systems reconciliation. Will be in charge of:
- Collection and analyses of data coming from different systems (i.e., data warehouse, databases, and web apps);
- Drafting reports, presentations, and business analyses related also, but not only, to web analytics services through BI tools;
- Taking care of churn and retention analysis, funnel optimization, A/B testing, customer scoring, and predictive modeling;
- Interacting with different teams, especially the Software Development and Accounting ones.


Requirements

- At least 1 year of experience in a similar role;
- Sound knowledge of MySQL;
- Sound knowledge of PowerBI or Tableau (aimed at creating and managing dashboards);
- Good Excel skills (i.e., complex formulas and visual charts);
- Familiarity with general economics concepts;
- Full professional proficiency in English.


Added values

- Familiarity with statistics, predictive models, and AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.);
- Sound knowledge of Python language (aimed at MySQL connections, CSV imports, connections with external sources, data processing, and data visualization);
- Good knowledge of marketing tools such as Heap.io, Funnel.io, or similar (aimed at extracting data and creating and managing dashboards);
- Proactive and willing to provide ideas and propose improvements;
- Previous experience in a SaaS company.


Location

At iubenda we believe in full-remote. Accordingly, you will be completely free and entitled to work from wherever you prefer in the world. At the same time in case you prefer to work from an office, at your disposal you have our Italian (Milan and Bologna) and German (Berlin and Hamburg) offices, to allow you to follow a hybrid work model.


Benefits

REMOTE WORK - You can work 100% remotely or if you prefer, from one of our beautiful offices in Italy (Bologna and Milan), and Germany (Hamburg). We are used and fully structured to onboard people who prefer to work full-time remotely.
TRAVEL ALLOWANCE TO VISIT A COLLEAGUE - We'll provide you with a budget so that you can spend time with your teammates based on the other side of the world;
COMPANY RETREATS AND COWORKING GATHERINGS - Once a year, we get together in amazing destinations to work, bond, and enjoy team-building activities. We offer fully paid week-long gatherings to places like Venice, Sicily, and the Dolomites.
LEARNING BUDGET - We'll sponsor your professional growth by providing a budget for certifications, events, courses, and books;
ENGLISH CLASSES - We offer online English classes weekly, within working hours, and on several different levels. We know there's always room to improve;
WORK EQUIPMENT - We'll provide an equipment allowance so that you can perform at your best;
BRIGHT & COLLABORATIVE WORK ENVIRONMENT - You will be part of a multicultural team of talented and experienced colleagues. Along with that, you will find a team spirit, which you would rarely find elsewhere!

By applying, you hereby declare that you have read and understood our privacy policy (https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/96274994).

Please send your CV in English.
Want to know more about iubenda? Check us out at:
iubenda.com | LinkedIn | Facebook |Twitter

¿Quiénes somos?




Optimissa es una empresa de consultoría IT especializada en Financial Services, siempre en búsqueda permanente de los mayores entusiastas de la Consultoría. Intentamos reinventarnos constantemente para así poder ofrecer el mejor lugar para que nuestros colaboradores puedan desarrollar su carrera y la mejor alternativa como partner para nuestros clientes. Experiencia con PowerBI
Experiencia en BBDD relacionales: SQL.

Title: Junior Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Nature and aim of the position




The Junior Commercial Data Analyst reports to Sales & Marketing Senior Analyst and he/she will be in charge of commercial/business analysis and data cleaning involving different datasets.




Main duties and responsibilities




Internal Reporting to check Commercial Portfolio’s trends (Account, Key Account, Currency Choice) and to identify areas of improvements;
Data Cleaning of different databases and CRM
Basic periodic reports like Insight, Commission Report, simple ad hoc analysis
Marketing Support for Content creation (infographics)
Currency Choice Support for Data analysis for supporting payments team




Skills:




Analytical skills, with accuracy and attention to detail

Tool: Excel, PowerPoint

Good presentation skills

Organized and rational

Able to communicate at different level both internally & externally

Business oriented

Adaptive, Open minded and Willing to learn;

Problem Solving;

Self-Motivated




Reporting and collaboration




The holder of this position reports to Sales & Marketing Senior Analyst and she/he collaborates with:

Marketing Sales Manager, Head of Payments, GB Lounge Manager;
Sales team;
Marketing Team;
Finance and Administration.




Background and Education




University Degree (economics and similar)

Good English level
Previous short experience as data analyst would be a plus
